articles.title: #51 Probably Nothing

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Zane and Draas
Re Across fields such as engineering, sciences, marketing, media etc — the broader vision is that Developer DAO can serve as a conduit for other communities, projects, and ideas to spin out of.
In his article, Luan refers to this as:
“…creating a cycle of value across web3.”

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Zane and Draas
Re The thesis, as laid out in Luan’s article — is to restructure Developer DAO into 2 overarching layers:
1. Operational
2. DAO
Within these layers, the DAO can operate across 3 primitives:
• Pods (workgroups)
• Hubs (core offerings)
• SubDAOs (entities founded by members)
articles.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re The thesis, as laid out in Luan’s article — is to restructure Developer DAO into 2 overarching layers: 1. Operational 2. DAO W...

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Zane and Draas
Re In his article, Luan explains that months of observations revealed that only a small number of members want to be ‘contributors’.
The majority would much rather use their membership to:
• Connect with people
• Join Hackathons 🏗️
• Learn
• Fundraise 💰
• Find a job
etc
articles.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re In his article, Luan explains that months of observations revealed that only a small number of members want to be ‘contributors...

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Zane and Draas
Re Developer DAO currently operates under a ‘Guild’ model, and it’s largely optimized for contributors. Outside of this, there aren’t a lot of ways members can get involved.
𝗢𝗕𝗦𝗘𝗥𝗩𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡
Guilds conflate contributors and non-contributors — often leading to some confusion.
articles.title: RT Zane and Draas: Re Developer DAO currently operates under a ‘Guild’ model, and it’s largely optimized for contributors. Outside of this, there a...

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Zane and Draas
Re A DAO is an acronym for ‘decentralized autonomous organization’.
These entities have no direct governing body or office. Rather, they operate on a system that empowers all members to make decisions.
And while they share a common interest or goal—DAO members are not a monolith.

articles.author: Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀)
articles.description:
RT Doc™
Another huge move for a @developer_dao member. Jeez, so many big moves by heavy hitters.
MardΞni (🧱, 🚀) 📍🇦🇪: Career Update!!
I'm so excited to share that I've joined @weave_db as a CEO! 🧬
I will be responsible for overseeing the company's strategic direction, building and maintaining relationships with key partners and developers, and driving growth and innovation!
👇🧵
articles.title: RT Doc™: Another huge move for a @developer_dao member. Jeez, so many big moves by heavy hitters.

articles.description:
RT Doc™
One of the greatest resources I've come across in the Web3 Space is @developer_dao.
When you've got massive talents like @dabit3, @camiinthisthang, and so many others in the DAO, you know great things are happening within.
Developer DAO (🧱, 🚀): On D_D YouTube channel there is a lot of knowledge to be found! 🤓
Do you still remember the third workshop on fundraising made by D_D Fundraising Operators @mr_cgc & @Wikist_? 👀
Present Your Path to Sustainability and Scale
If you missed it:
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z0xqty_fvJg

articles.description:
RT Gaby Goldberg
My reading list is alive and well. Highlights include last week's read from @slatestarcodex, The Cost of Being Right by @divine_economy, & On Crypto Populism by @richardchen39.
I try my best to keep up but if there are pieces I missed, please tweet me! http://web3readinglist.com
